The Rise of Intelligent Decision-Making


At the heart of AI-driven market mechanisms is the ability to process vast volumes of structured and unstructured data in real time. Unlike legacy models reliant on periodic analysis and manual intervention, modern AI systâ€¦

articles.author: LearnHowToCode
articles.description:
When your system is still small, you have only one database. All operations â€” both reads and writes â€” go through the same path, and everything seems to flow naturally. But then the system starts to grow. Users multiply. The number of queries increases exponentially. And you will realize a simple truth: most of the requests are merely read operations.
Browsing products. Scrolling through a timeline. Searching for posts. Each of these actions consumes I/O, CPU, and memory resources on the database. At first, you may think, "Itâ€™s just reading â€” how heavy can it be?" But reads, when there are enough of them, can gradually and surely choke the system.
Thatâ€™s when read replicas become a weapon you must consider.
The solution is conceptually simple: you replicate your primary database into multipâ€¦
articles.title: Read Replicas: Offloading Load by Sharing Reads

articles.description:
Introduction
In this article, we will address the issue of the 'file not found' error related to the SimpleBLE library in C++. If you are trying to compile a project in Xcode and encounter the error simpleble/SimpleBLE.h file not found, this guide will walk you through potential solutions to make your header files visible and ensure successful compilation.
Understanding the Issue
When working with libraries in C++, specifically with the SimpleBLE library version 0.9.1 in Xcode 11.7 on a Late 2013 iMac running macOS Catalina 10.15.7, you might face challenges in linking the necessary header files. This issue often arises due to incorrect project settings, missing paths, or improperly configured build settings.
Common Causes for 'File Not Found' Error
Incorrect Include Paths: Your project maâ€¦
articles.title: How to Fix 'file not found' Error in SimpleBLE with C++?

articles.author: Olivia Carter
articles.description:
When it comes to website security, just having HTTPS in your URL bar isnâ€™t enough anymore. These days, itâ€™s the baseline, not the finish line. Installing an SSL certificate is a solid first step, but if you've come across the warning "HSTS Missing from HTTPS Server", it means there's still a gap in your defenses that hackers could take advantage of.
In this post, weâ€™ll break down what that error actually means, why itâ€™s something you shouldnâ€™t ignore, and how to fix it, one step at a time.
If you're seeing that error, it means your server isnâ€™t sending a specific HTTP response header called Strict-Transport-Security. This header is what activates HTTP Strict Transport Security, or HSTS for short.
Hereâ€™s the short version: HSTS tells web browsers, "Hey, this site should only ever load over â€¦
articles.title: How to Resolve 'HSTS Missing from HTTPS Server' Error on Your Website

articles.author: Sospeter Mong'are
articles.description:
If you're building a Laravel API that allows users to upload multiple images (like attachments to tasks), this guide will walk you through how to do it â€” simply and clearly.
In your controller (TaskController), make sure to validate that users can upload multiple images:
$validator = Validator::make($request->all(), [
    'title' => 'required|string|max:255',
    'attachments' => 'nullable|array',
    'attachments.*' => 'file|mimes:jpg,jpeg,png,pdf,docx|max:2048',
]);

This accepts an array of files (attachments[]) with allowed formats and size.
Each task can have many images, so we need a table to store them.
Run this command:
php artisan make:migration create_task_attachments_table

Edit the file:
Schema::create('task_attachments', function (Blueprint $table) {
    $table->id();
    $tabâ€¦
articles.title: How to Upload Multiple Images in a Laravel API (Step-by-Step)

articles.author: David Espejo
articles.description:
In this post, Iâ€™ll explain how Flyteâ€™s Dynamic Workflows work and what they mean for your ML pipelines.
Flyte Workflows define a pipeline as a Directed Acyclic Graph (DAG). This abstraction allows the representation of complex processes with branches, but without loops. Consequently, each new execution of the DAG must start from the beginning or from an intermediate point, which can impact compute efficiencyâ€”more on that in future posts.
Flyteâ€™s workflow lifecycle has two main phases: compile time and run time.
During compile time, Flyte serializes the code, packages it, and uploads it to blob storage, making it accessible to the control plane. This process is called registration. The focus here is on speed and efficiency, primarily by performing type checking without executing the code. Iâ€¦
articles.title: Understanding Flyte's Dynamic Workflows: How They Power Scalable ML Pipelines

articles.author: Shubham Joshi
articles.description:
Selenium is one of the most popular and widely used automation test suites to automate web applications. It can perform from very basic to advanced actions on a web page, such as clicking on a button, sending text in the input field, selecting an item from a drop down, performing mouse-keyboard actions, etc. However, there are instances when Selenium WebDriver cannot interact with certain web elements and that is when JavascriptExecutor is used!
JavascriptExecutor is an interface that facilitates a mechanism to execute JavaScript through Selenium WebDriver. This interface provides various methods to run JavaScript on the selected window or the current web page. Selenium WebDriver supports different language bindings and JavascriptExecutor is available in each of those bindings. JavaScript â€¦
articles.title: Using JavaScriptExecutor in Selenium: Unlocking Advanced Web Interactions

When learning Java, one of the most important concepts youâ€™ll come across is how to compare values. This is especially relevant when working with strings and objects that need to be sorted or evaluated in a certain order. In this context, the compareTo Java method becomes an essential tool in your programming toolkit.
This blog aims to give you a beginner-friendly overview of the compareTo() method in Java, explaining how it works, where itâ€™s used, and how you can understand its output. Weâ€™ll also touch on related concepts such as Java String format to help you present your results clearly and professionally.

The compareTo() method in Java is part of the Comparable interface. Its main purpose is to compare two objects and determine their order with respect to each other. Most commonly, itâ€¦
articles.title: Understanding compareTo() in Java: A Beginner's Guide

articles.author: Generatecode
articles.description:
When utilizing the wc -l command in Bash to count lines across multiple files, users often notice that the line counts are perfectly aligned with spaces, providing a clearer output. This consistent formatting raises an interesting question: how does wc manage to format its output correctly without reading all files in advance? In this article, we'll explore the mechanics behind the wc command, the alignment practices it employs, and why the output retains perfect formatting even when handling large files.
Understanding the wc Command in Bash
The wc command, short for "word count," is a powerful utility in UNIX and Linux environments that allows users to count lines, words, and characters in files. Specifically, the -l flag counts lines, meaning wc -l <filename> will output the number of liâ€¦
articles.title: How does wc command align line counts in Bash output?

Over the past week, Doodles recorded $2.6 million in total sales volume â€” up 368% from the week prior â€” ranking fifth among all NFT collections, according to CryptoSlam.

articles.description:
The Ethereum Pectra upgrade introduced a significant upgrade in account abstraction accessibility, with multiple wallets already implementing the change.
Pectra introduced Ethereum Improvement Proposal (EIP) 7702, a change that Ivo Georgiev, founder and CEO of self-custodial smart wallet Ambire, described as â€œthe single greatest UX upgrade to Ethereum so far.â€ Ambire is among the wallet providers that have already rolled out support for the new features since Pectra went live yesterday.
Ambireâ€™s announcement shared with Cointelegraph explains that EIP-7702 brings smart account functionality to existing user accounts, letting them temporarily act as smart contracts. This results in the advantages of account abstraction being accessible without creating new dedicated onchain addresses, rendeâ€¦
articles.title: Pectra features already in use: Ethereum EIP-7702 wallets roll out

As of May 2025, Bitcoin mining is looking attractive again. With Bitcoin (BTC) trading around $95,000 and transaction fees hitting new highs after the 2024 halving, mining rewards â€” though smaller â€” are worth chasing. From home setups to industrial-scale farms, the question of whether Bitcoin mining is profitable is back in the spotlight.
And if youâ€™re a gamer, chances are youâ€™ve looked at your rig and wondered: Can a gaming PC mine crypto? After all, modern gaming computers are packed with powerful GPUs, solid cooling and lots of downtime, especially if youâ€™re not gaming daily. Itâ€™s a fair question: Can you mine Bitcoin with a gaming PC?
The short answer: Yes, but it wonâ€™t be worth it.Â

articles.title: Can you mine Bitcoin with a gaming PC? Hereâ€™s what you need to know

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Almost 60,000 Bitcoin addresses tied to LockBitâ€™s ransomware infrastructure were leaked after hackers breached the groupâ€™s dark web affiliate panel.Â 
The leak included a MySQL database dump shared publicly online. It contained crypto-related information that could help blockchain analysts trace the groupâ€™s illicit financial flows.  
Ransomware is a type of malware used by malicious actors. It locks its targetâ€™s files or computer systems, making them inaccessible. The attackers typically demand a ransom payment, often in digital assets like Bitcoin (BTC), in exchange for a decryption key to unlock the files.
LockBit is one of the most notorious crypto ransomware groups. In February 2024, 10 countries launched a joint operation to disrupt the group, saying that the organization had caused biâ€¦
articles.title: 60K Bitcoin addresses leaked as LockBit ransomware gang gets hacked

David Bailey, CEO of crypto media company BTC Inc. and a close adviser to US President Donald Trump on digital assets, has reportedly raised $300 million to launch a new Bitcoin investment firm.
The venture, named Nakamoto after the pseudonymous creator of Bitcoin, Satoshi Nakamoto, aims to become a publicly traded company focused on acquiring and holding the cryptocurrency, CNBC reported, citing people familiar with the matter. The InformationÂ was first to cover the story.
The funding round, which has been quietly in motion since January, includes $200 million in equity and $100 million in convertible debt, a source familiar with the matter told CNBC.
While the firm has not officially announced the raise, an official reveal and merger with a Nasdaq-listed company is expected as early as nâ€¦

articles.description:
The US Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) has confirmed banks under its jurisdiction can trade crypto on behalf of customers and outsource some crypto activities to third parties.Â 
Acting comptroller Rodney Hood said in a May 7 letter that banks and federal savings associations can buy and sell crypto they hold in custody at customersâ€™ direction.
The OCC added in a press release that financial institutions can also outsource bank-permissible crypto activities, including custody and execution services, to third parties in compliance with applicable law.
â€œAdditionally, these banks may provide other custody services, including record keeping, tax or reporting services for their customers,â€ Hood said in a May 7 video posted to X.Â 

OCC-regulated banks may buy and sell assets held â€¦
articles.title: US banks can handle customer crypto assets held in custody, regulator confirms

A Texas House Committee has passed a Republican-backed bill to create a Bitcoin reserve, which now only needs a successful full floor vote before heading to the governorâ€™s desk.
The Texas House Committee on Delivery of Government Efficiency passed Senate Bill 21 with no amendments on May 7 in a 9-4 vote along party lines. The bill has already passed the Texas Senate, in a 25-5 vote on March 6.  
SB 21 would establish the â€œTexas Strategic Bitcoin Reserve,â€ controlled by the stateâ€™s comptroller â€” currently Glenn Hegar â€” who would be permitted to invest in digital assets that have obtained a market cap of at least $500 billion over the last twelve months, which would currently only include Bitcoin (BTC).

Republican Senator Charles Schwertner initially introduced SB 21 â€¦

He added inflation has â€œcome down a great deal but has been running above our 2% longer objective.â€ Powell said surveys in households and businesses showed a â€œsharp decline in sentimentâ€ mainly dueâ€¦

Arizona Governor Katie Hobbs has signed a bill into law allowing the US state to keep unclaimed crypto and establish a â€œBitcoin Reserve Fundâ€ that wonâ€™t use any taxpayer money or state funds.
Hobbs signed House Bill 2749 into law on May 7, which allows Arizona to claim ownership of abandoned digital assets if the owner fails to respond to communications within three years.
The stateâ€™s custodians can stake the crypto to earn rewards or receive airdrops, which can then be deposited into what Arizona has called a Bitcoin and Digital Asset Reserve Fund.
â€œThis law ensures Arizona doesnâ€™t leave value sitting on the table and puts us in a position to lead the country in how we secure, manage, and ultimately benefit from abandoned digital currency,â€ the billâ€™s sponsor, Jeff Weninger, said in a Mayâ€¦

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
Stripe, a global payments platform, has introduced stablecoin-based accounts to clients in over 100 countries. 
According to a May 7 announcement, the new feature will allow the platform's clients "to send, receive, and hold US-dollar stablecoin account balances, similar to how a traditional fiat bank account works."
The product's technical page shows that the new account feature will support Circle's USDC (USDC) and Bridge's USDB (USDB) stablecoins. Stripe acquired the Bridge platform in October 2024.
The product will be available to clients in more than 100 countries, including Argentina, ChilÃ©, Turkey, Colombia, and Peru, among others.
Stripe's newly launched product comes at a time when stablecoins are increasingly seen as stores of value in developing economies struggling with high inâ€¦
articles.title: Stripe rolls out stablecoin accounts in over 100 countries

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Brokerage fintech Robinhood is reportedly developing a blockchain network that will enable retail investors in Europe to trade US securities.
According to a May 7 Bloomberg report citing sources familiar with the matter, the move seeks to expand the company's local presence by offering trading of tokenized securities, such as stocks. 
Two crypto firms, Arbitrum and the Solana Foundation, are reportedly vying to become partners in the project. Tokenization is the process of turning real-world assets, like stocks, real estate, or commodities, into digital tokens that can be traded on a blockchain.
Tokenizing securities instead of providing direct exposure can offer several advantages: reduced costs by eliminating traditional financial infrastructure, enhanced accessibility, faster settlementâ€¦
articles.title: Robinhood plans blockchain for US asset trading in Europe: Report

articles.description:

Lyn Alden says a weaker dollar is necessary for the US to stabilize its financial system.

Bitcoin and gold are well-positioned to benefit from de-dollarization.

Sovereign wealth funds and various nations are already increasing their Bitcoin exposure as the dollarâ€™s global dominance starts to wane.

The weakening of the US dollar (DXY) is no longer headline news. With mounting disruptions across the US economy, a declining greenback has become part of the backdrop. Since the start of 2025, the US Dollar Index has dropped 11%, now hovering around levels last seen in April 2022. Markets have largely responded with a shrug. After all, in times of deep restructuring, isnâ€™t some dollar weakness to be expected?
The trouble is, this might not be a temporary dip. The dollarâ€™s slideâ€¦
articles.title: Falling DXY part of US financial systemâ€™s â€˜long-term transitionâ€™ â€” Will Bitcoin continue to shine?

In a May 6 X post after court proceedings had likely ended for the day, Karony said he was innocent and â€œdid not commit fraudâ€ in response to media coverage of his trial. The former CEO, as well as SafeMoon creator Kyle Nagy and former chief technology officer Thomas Smith, were charged in 2023 for having allegedly â€œdiverted and misappropriated millions of dollarsâ€™ worthâ€ of the platformâ€™s SFM token.

Binance-affiliated BNB Chain has rebounded after a period of stagnation in 2023 amid accelerating institutional and decentralized finance (DeFi) adoption.Â 
During the past year, BNB Chain has benefited from multibillion-dollar inflows into DeFi, US exchange-traded funds (ETFs), and rising trading volume at affiliated centralized exchange (CEX) Binance.Â 
Consequently, the blockchain networkâ€™s native BNB token (BNB) has emerged as among the marketâ€™s most resilient cryptocurrencies, surpassing all-time highs in the first quarter of 2025 even as the broader crypto market trended downward.Â 
â€œThis resilience isn't just about price action â€” strong fundamentals also back it,â€ Joao Wedson, CEO of investing analytics platform Alphractal, said in an April X post.Â â€œBinance has built a massive ecosysteâ€¦

Cointelegraph reached out to Coinbase but was unable to get a response by the time of publication.

Bessent addressed lawmakers at a May 7 hearing of the House Financial Services Committee, saying that the United States should be the â€œpremier destination for digital assetsâ€ in response to a question about American dominance over China in crypto-related innovation. The Treasury Secretary added that â€œgood market structureâ€ and â€œstablecoin legislationâ€ could help ensure this outcome.
US Treasury Secretary speaking at a May 7 hearing. Source: Scott Bessent

articles.title: US Treasury Secretary expresses support for crypto bills at hearing

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Threat group COLDRIVER is using new malware to steal documents from Western targets, according to a May 7 report from Google Threat Intelligence. The malware, called LOSTKEYS, shows the evolution of the group from credential phishing to more sophisticated attacks.
According to the Google report, the new malware is installed through four steps. The process involves a â€œlure websiteâ€ with a fake CAPTCHA, a PowerShell script downloaded to the userâ€™s clipboard, some device evasion, and retrieval of the final payload. Lastly, the malware is installed.
LOSTKEYS payload delivery. Source: Google
LOSTKEYS is capable of stealing files from extensions and directories. It can also send system information and running processes back to COLDRIVER. The address from which the parts of the attack come is â€œ16â€¦
articles.title: COLDRIVER using new malware to steal from Western targets â€” Google

Bitcoinâ€™s realized capitalization hit a record $890 billion, reflecting strong investor conviction as long-term and short-term holders increased allocations. 

Large Bitcoin holders with over 1,000 BTC have accumulated significantly since March 2025, reflecting the Q1 2024 trend.

Bitcoin (BTC) price saw a short-squeeze above $97,000 on May 6, shortly after US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent announced that trade talks would commence with China on May 10. At the same time, BTCâ€™s realized capitalization, a metric adding the dollar value of all coins at their last moved price, soared to a new all-time high of $890 billion on May 7, 2025. The surge also marks the metricâ€™s third consecutive week of record-breaking growth.
Bitcoin realized cap. Source: CryptoQuant
The realized â€¦
articles.title: Bitcoin â€˜Realized Capâ€™ hits $890B as BTC traders focus on recapturing $100K

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex Oâ€™Donnell
articles.description:
Strive Asset Management, founded by entrepreneur and former presidential candidate Vivek Ramaswamy, has revealed plans to transition into a Bitcoin treasury company.
According to a May 7 announcement, Strive is going public through a reverse merger and plans to use the combined companyâ€™s stock to accumulate Bitcoin (BTC).
The deal will see Strive merging with Asset Entities, a social media marketing company listed on the Nasdaq. The combined entity will operate under the Strive brand and use its access to the public equity markets to finance Bitcoin purchases, the company said.Â 
Once the deal closes, Strive plans to issue approximately $1 billion in equity and debt and use the proceeds to accumulate BTC.Â The asset manager â€œintends to use all available mechanisms to build a Bitcoin war chesâ€¦
articles.title: Strive to become Bitcoin treasury company

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Rakesh Upadhyay

Key points:

Bitcoin price hangs near $97,000 as traders await todayâ€™s FOMC minutes.

Bitcoin holding $95,000 as support is key for bullish price expansion in the short term.

Select altcoins are holding their respective support levels, opening the gates for a short-term rally.

Bitcoin (BTC) bulls are trying to knock down the immediate resistance at $97,895 and challenge the all-important $100,000 level. Crypto analytics platform Santiment said in a post on X that Bitcoin wallets holding between 10 and 10,000 Bitcoin are positive about further gains as they have acquired 81,338 Bitcoin over the past six weeks.
Investors have also been piling into BlackRockâ€™s spot Bitcoin exchange-traded fund for the past 16 days, which has boosted its new capital inflows to about $4.7 billion, according tâ€¦

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Vince Quill
articles.description:
The Bybit exchange has recovered its liquidity to pre-hack levels just 30 days following the February 2025 attack that drained nearly $1.5 billion in funds.
According to a report from crypto research and analytics firm Kaiko, Bitcoin's (BTC) 1% market depth, a measure of liquidity, returned to pre-hack levels of around $13 million per day in March 2025.
Bitcoin liquidity on Bybit exchange rebounds to pre-hack levels. Source: Kaiko
Altcoin liquidity levels on the exchange have been slower to recover than Bitcoin but have rebounded to around 80% of the pre-hack levels. The authors of the Kaiko report added:
"This lag is largely due to the risk-off market environment, which has impacted altcoins more severely. While Bitcoin is still seen as a risky asset, it remains the crypto marketâ€™s safe hâ€¦
articles.title: Bybit recovers liquidity levels 30 days after hack â€” Kaiko

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Turner Wright
articles.description:
At least some of the top holders of Donald Trumpâ€™s memecoin who apply to attend a private dinner with the president could be based outside the United States.
According to a May 7 Bloomberg report based on an analysis of the top TRUMP tokenholders, 19 of the top 25 wallets on the leaderboard used foreign exchanges that exclude US-based customers, suggesting either foreign nationals or Americans living abroad. In addition, more than half of the top 220 holders â€” the group eligible to apply for a dinner with the president â€” also used exchanges in other countries.
Top 10 TRUMP memecoin holders as of May. 7. Source: Trump meme
As of May 7, the identities of the top tokenholders and those who might choose to apply for the May 22 Trump dinner and â€œspecial VIP tourâ€ were unknown. However, the projâ€¦
articles.title: Trump memecoin dinner attendees could include foreign nationals â€” Report
